## Paleo Ground Beef Lunch for Potluck (1 Hour)

A hearty, paleo-friendly ground beef dish perfect for sharing at a potluck, prepared in one hour.

### Ingredients
- 2 pounds ground beef (grass-fed preferred)
- 1 large onion, diced (about 1 cup)
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 large bell pepper (any color), diced
- 1 cup chopped zucchini
- 1 can (14.5 ounces) diced tomatoes, no added sugar
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 teaspoon sea salt
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- 1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes (optional)
- Fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish, optional)

### Instructions
1. Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet or Dutch oven over medium-high heat for 1 minute.
2. Add the diced onion and cook for 3 minutes, stirring occasionally, until translucent.
3. Add the minced garlic and cook for 30 seconds, stirring constantly.
4. Push the onion and garlic to one side of the skillet.
5. Add the ground beef to the empty side of the skillet and cook for 8-10 minutes, breaking it apart with a spatula, until browned and cooked through.
6. Stir in the diced bell pepper and zucchini. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are tender.
7. Pour in the diced tomatoes with juice. Mix well.
8. Add salt, black pepper, oregano, basil, and red pepper flakes (if using). Stir to combine.
9. Reduce heat to medium, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
10. Taste and adjust seasoning if needed.
11. Garnish with chopped parsley if desired. Serve hot or at room temperature.

### Notes
- This recipe makes approximately 4-6 servings, suitable for a potluck. Double the ingredients if needed.
- Serve with paleo-friendly side salads or vegetable dishes.
